result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark L. Taholski Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent/Deliver Narcotics [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Submit to DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling per agent.  Absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances unless valid Rx and use accordingly.  Not entry into taverns or liquor stores or locations where drug paraphernalia is sold.  Submit to random urinalysis.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mark L. Taholski in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Defendant Mark L. Taholski in custody.  John Newton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea to Count 1.  With repeater.    No contest plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  PSI is waived.  State gives final statement. Attorney Klopp gives final statement. Court imposes sentence.
WI State Prison for 5 1/2 years (2 years Initial Confinement/3 1/2 years Extended Supervision)   106 days credit.
DNA surcharge $250/sample
Undergo any counseling per agent.
AODA & treatment
Absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances unless valid Rx and use accordingly.  
No entry into taverns or liquor stores or locations where drug paraphernalia is sold.
Submit to random urinalysis
Maintain full time employment
Restitution in 14CF378
$268.00 Costs & Supervision Fees
Not Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program 
Eligible for Earned Release/Substance Abuse Program
Paperwork handed in court.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 24, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Mark L. Taholski in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Defendant Mark L. Taholski in custody.  John A. Newton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and Atty Newton states appearances and status.  States matter will be resolved and plea/sent set out for later but prelim/arraignment to be completed today.  14CF193 to be set along w/this one also as they are both resolved.  Court notes matters would be set in Br 3 for plea/sent as he holds the oldest case.  Atty Newton states they will get a date from Br 3 after court.  Atty Klopp agrees that there will be a prelim waiver today.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on June 6, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Mark L. Taholski appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Tom Steinman. Prosecuting Atty Sue M Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  DE does qualify for PD representation.  State requests $1500.00 Cash bail.  Atty. Steinman requests signature bond and explains history.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits NOT waived.  $1500.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact w/M.B. or J.G.; No possession of controlled substances w/o valid Rx and use in accordance to the Rx if have one  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
